oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis, spectroscopic study and X-ray crystal structure of unsymmetrical bis(phosphine)-platinum complex, [PtCl2{eta(2)-Ph2POCH2CH2N(CH3)PPh2]
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BALAKRISHNA, MS
MCDONALD, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: transition-metal chemistry
phosphorus-based ligands

unsymmetrical bis(phosphine)

chelate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The bis(phosphine), Ph2POCH2CH2N(CH3)PPh2 (1) reacts with [Pt(COD)Cl-2] to give seven-membered cis-chelated complex 2. The complex was characterized by elemental analysis, IR, and NMR spectroscopic methods of which the P-31{H-1} MR data is very informative and allows the direct measure of the P-P coupling through metal centers otherwise can not be seen in the free ligand as the two phosphorus centers are five-bonds apart. The structure of the platinum(H) complex was determined by X-ray crystallography. (C) 2002 .
